name: BEST WESTERN Alfa Aeropuerto

reviews.text: The good things - the price was pretty good plus it included transportation from & to the airport. This service starts at 0500 so if you have a really early flight out a taxi will set you back around €30. You can get a bus into the city (about 8km) & back as they run all night & it's cheap. The hotel bar prices are very good, a bottle of Vina Sol white wine is only €9, we pay roughly £6 in the supermarket for that. Higher taxes in the UK & it's imported I know but makes me think that the Spanish economy might benefit from hiking tax on booze & fags a bit. You can buy 200 cigs in a tobacco shop in the city for €40 which of course includes Spanish tax, much cheaper than in UK.
reviews.title: Transport to/from airport included

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not so good things - the hotel is on a really busy road so you wouldn't want a room at the front of the building. It appears to be on the edge of the biggest industrial estate in Spain but then it is close to the airport.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public area on the ground floor is very small. It includes reception with a few seats, a bar with tables & soft seating & a small restaurant, which only really caters for Spanish & late arrivals because they do not open in the evening until 2030! We all know the Spanish eat late but this is a tourist hotel & they should serve dinner from much earlier for us northern Europeans & others who do not like to eat a large meal so late in the evening, & of course children. The bar does have a snack menu so we had to make do with that.
reviews.title: Heartily recommend for airport or cruise ship access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worse than this is the fact that the local police (there's a police station nearby) come into the bar in uniform & with guns, in groups of 3 or 4, every evening with their radio's barking out goodness knows what while they take over the bar stools drinking coffee, which they don't pay for. When we asked why we should have to put up with this intrusion the staff said there is nothing they can do about it as the police do as they like. The other time we saw them they were actually doing some work after a lady had been sitting in reception with her handbag on the floor next to her & a female thief grabbed the bag & ran off down the road. So be warned! Barcelona has had a bad reputation for pick pockets & thieves for years & sadly it seems that nothing has changed.
reviews.title: Best hotel close to Barcelona airport
Does what it says
reviews.text: No matter what standard of accommodation is booked or what price paid the most fundamental thing hotel's should get right is the provision of a comfortable bed. We were booked in for 3 nights so you would have thought they'd have given us one of the newer beds in the first place, but no. It was a double which had visibly sunk in the middle & my partner felt springs protruding. We complained & we were moved to the room next door which had a much better & newer bed, or rather beds, as they were 2 large singles pushed together. We were there to meet my sister & brother-in-law who had been holidaying in Europe & were staying at the Alfa hotel too on their way back home to Vancouver. They were only there 1 night but unfortunately had a dreadful double bed in their room as well. Perhaps the answer here is to book twin beds if you value your sleep.

My party of four stayed one night. We had a very short amount of time in-between a cruise (terrible) and a departing flight back to the states. We decided not to chance it so we stayed in Barcelona overnight and caught our flight the next day. Upon arrival in Barcelona (cruise) we took the transfer from the ship back to the airport. At the airport we went down to arrival and went to the central area for hotel shuttles. The shuttle was timely to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Convenient to airport after cruise

reviews.text: The hotel is OK, not glamorous at all. Primarily caters to the business crowd. The hotel is located in an industrial / office park area. There are no restaurants in the area except one. It was sort of a bar / restaurant / truck stop / cafeteria style. We walked to the restaurant, took a good look, turned around and went back to the hotel. In reality, we should have tried the truck stop restaurant because the restaurant in the hotel was terrible.
reviews.title: Hotel Alpha

reviews.text: Do take to public bus (2euros) in front of the hotel to downtown Barcelona and explore. Do have lunch or dinner in the city and bring a doggie bag if you like to snack later.

Beware there are two terminals at the barcelona airport at it can take you some time to change the terminal. Free shuttle. Computer, printer, posiibility of express breakfast for small price everything what you expect from airport hotel. A bit far from the sity (40 minutes by train) so not recommended for sightseeing, but excellent if you have early departure

reviews.title: Not bad, needs better customer service

aka: Best Western Alfa Aeropuerto Hotel Barcelona
description: Hotel situated near airport, and near Fira de Barcelona (exhibitor's center). We provide a free shuttle service from 5.00am to 23.30pm from/to "Barcelona El Prat Airport". We are 15 minutes from Barcelona city center. Public Transportation avaible in front of the hotel. Free Wifi with high speed in the whole hotel even the garden, free Mac for printing your boarding passes or whatever you need, FullHD TVs in rooms, 8 euros/day parking while you are away (use our free shuttle service), high-quality restaurant well-known in the area, room-service also avaible, we have a complete "breakfast buffett" and also "breakfast express" for busy people, running/jogging area beside the hotel by the river, birdwatching area 5 minutes from hotel using our bikes,... we are here to serve you.
